segment.name: User Info
segment.description: Change name and description of this throttle for LCC network browsers.

string.name: User Name
string.description: This name will appear in network browsers for this device.

string.name: User Description
string.description: This description will appear in network browsers for this device.

segment.name: Throttle Settings
segment.description: Settings that adjust the throttle behavior.

group.name: Change Buttons
group.description:
There are up to eight customizable buttons on the handheld: - four directly under the display - two to the left of the thumbwheel - two to the right of the thumbwheel
These buttons are indexed below as follows: 1 left most directly under the display 2 left of center directly under the display 3 right of center directly under the display 4 right most directly under the display 5 upper left of the thumb-wheel 6 upper right of the thumb-wheel 7 lower left of the thumb-wheel 8 lower right of the thumb-wheel

int.name: Common Functions
int.description: Use this option if you want the selected softkey to operate a commonly used function with a name, such as Brake or Bell. If there is no roster information with which to associate a function number to the selected option, the throttle will automatically override your selection with the next numerical button that is not already in use.

int.name: F0 - F28
int.description: Use this option if you want the selected softkey to always operate the same numbered funtion every time, such as F0, F1, F2, etc.

group.name: WT Consist Funcs
group.description: Allows customizing Loco Functions behavior when driving a consist in WiThrottle Protocol mode.

int.name: Function Routing
int.description: Specifies where this function should go when driving a consist created in the throttle in WiThrottle Protocol mode.

group.name: Drive Settings
group.description: Settings related to the operation of locomotives.

int.name: Fast Inc/Dec Speed
int.description: Specifies how much speed should be added or subtracted for each press of the fast increment/decrement button.

int.name: Reversal Stopping
int.description: Sets whether the loco speed be set to zero when the direction change button is pressed, or keep running at the previous speed in the opposite direction.

int.name: Workaround for Recall 0 Speed
int.description: On some systems connected via JMRI (e.g. NCE), after recalling a locomotive the speed is displayed as zero even if the locomotive is running. Enable this option to work around the issue.

int.name: Active Brightness
int.description: Sets the active brightness of the backlight; 0=off, 100=max.

int.name: Idle Brightness
int.description: Sets the idle brightness of the backlight; 0=off, 100=max.

int.name: Throttle Timeout
int.description: Sets how many seconds the backlight should be active after each keypress while running trains on the Drive window. If set to zero, the backlight will never go idle.

int.name: Menu Timeout
int.description: Sets how many seconds the backlight should be active after each keypress while in a menu. If set to zero, the backlight will never go idle.

int.name: Contrast
int.description: Adjusts the LCD darkness, improving readability in some cases. Increase value to darken, decrease value to lighten.

group.name: Power Settings
group.description: Settings related to the battery life of the throttle.

int.name: Auto Power-Off
int.description: After this many minutes, if not in use, the cab will turn off. 0=forever.

group.name: E-Stop Settings
group.description: Configures the behavior of the red Emergency Stop button. The E-STOP function can be configured to perform multiple stages of E-STOP. If multiple options are enabled, press the button multiple times to escalate to the next stage. For information on specific stages, press the Help or ? button for the options in the following submenu.

int.name: Current Locomotive
int.description: Allows emergency stop of the currently selected locomotive or consist.

int.name: Stop All Locomotives
int.description: Allows emergency stop of all locomotives. Unused in WiThrottle Protocol mode.

int.name: Power Off Layout
int.description: Allows powering off the layout.

int.name: Clear Timeout
int.description: Timeout in seconds after which the emergency state can be cleared. Caution: a value of 0 only allows for one kind of emergency stop to be supported.

group.name: Fast Clock
group.description: Sets whether the fast clock is shown, and the format to use for the fast clock (12 or 24 hour).

int.name: Show Fast Clock
int.description: Allows showing the fast clock on the drive window on systems that support a fast clock.

int.name: Clock Format
int.description: Allows displaying the fast clock in a 12 hour or 24 hour format.

int.name: LCC Clock ID
int.description: The Clock ID used by this device in LCC mode. Most users do not need to edit this field. The LCC standard defines four "well-known" clock ID's. It is also possible to specify a custom clock ID. If choosing "Custom User", the user can specify any ID of their choosing which is under their own control.

eventid.name: LCC Custom Clock ID Event Base
eventid.description: 48-bit Unique ID, right padded with "00.00". Normally, the chosen clocks's 48-bit ID is automatically filled in. When Choosing "Custom User", a custom 48-bit ID, right padded with "00.00", may be filled in.

segment.name: Network Settings
segment.description: Configures the settings for the network connections.

int.name: Show Welcome Tutorial
int.description: Shows the welcome screen at the next start of the throttle.

int.name: Regulatory Region
int.description: Set the regulatory region. Use of this product is only valid when operating in one of the selected regulatory region countries. NA: United States Canada UK/EU/AU/NZ: Australia Austria Belgium Bulgaria Croatia Cyprus Czech Republic Denmark Estonia Finland France Germany Greece Hungary Iceland Ireland Italy Latvia Liechtenstein Lithuania Luxembourg Malta Netherlands New Zealand Norway Poland Porugal Romania Slovakia Spain Sweden Switzerland Turkey United Kingdom

int.name: Privacy Mode
int.description: Privacy Mode makes the throttle use a Randomized MAC address instead of the hardware address when connecting to WiFi networks. This makes it harder to track your device or infer the manufacturer and model of your device. By selecting 'New' you can have a new Randomized address generated. You can view the in-use MAC address in Menu > About.

group.name: Profiles
group.description: Configures settings for a single wifi network.

string.name: Name (SSID)
string.description: The wifi network that these settings apply to.

string.name: Password
string.description: Set the password for this network. Use empty if no password is required.

int.name: LCC/WT Mode
int.description: Select whether to use LCC protocol or JMRI WiThrottle protocol on this network. Use JMRI WiThrottle setting to simulate smartphones or use this throttle with an LNWI.

group.name: Advanced
group.description: Advanced network settings for this profile, such as fixed IP address.

group.name: LCC Client
group.description: Set advanced configuration for connecting to an LCC server on this wifi network.

int.name: Search Mode
int.description: Defines the order of how to locate the server to connect to. 'auto' uses the mDNS protocol to find the IP address automatically. 'manual' uses the IP address entered in this settings.

group.name: Manual Address
group.description: Set IP address here if auto-detection does not work.

string.name: IP Address
string.description: Enter the server IP address. Example: 192.168.0.55

int.name: Port Number
int.description: TCP port number of the server. Most of the time this does not need to be changed.

group.name: Auto Address
group.description: Advanced settings for the server IP address auto-detection (mDNS).

string.name: mDNS Service
string.description: mDNS or Bonjour service name, such as _openlcb-can._tcp

string.name: Only Hostname
string.description: Use when multiple servers provide the same service on the network. If set, selects this specific host name; the connection will fail if none of the servers have this hostname (use correct capitalization!). Example: My JMRI Railroad

int.name: Reconnect
int.description: If enabled, tries the last known good IP address before searching for the server.

group.name: WiThrottle Client
group.description: Set advanced configuration for connecting to a WiThrottle server on this wifi network.
